  • Method Details

    • find

      private int find​(Album album)
      Searches for an Album in a Collection
      Parameters:
      album - is the album we are looking for
      Returns:
      index of the album if found or else returns -1

    • grow

      private void grow()
      Increases the capacity of the Albums array by 4

    • add

      public boolean add​(Album album)
      Adds an Album to the end of the Collection.
      Parameters:
      album - is Album we want to add.
      Returns:
      true if Album is successfully added or false if the Album already exists in the Collection

    • remove

      public boolean remove​(Album album)
      Removes an Album from a Collection and maintains the same order.
      Parameters:
      album - is Album we want to remove.
      Returns:
      true if Album is successfully removed or false if Album does not exist in Collection

    • lendingOut

      public boolean lendingOut​(Album album)
      Sets an Album to not available when lent out.
      Parameters:
      album - is Album we want to lend out.
      Returns:
      true if Album is successfully lent out or false is album does not exist or is already unavailable

    • returnAlbum

      public boolean returnAlbum​(Album album)
      Sets an Album to available when returned.
      Parameters:
      album - is Album that is returned.
      Returns:
      true if Album is successfully returned or false is album does not exist or is already available

    • print

      public void print()
      Print the Albums in no specific order.

    • printByReleaseDate

      public void printByReleaseDate()
      Print the Albums in order of Release Date.

    • printByGenre

      public void printByGenre()
      Print the Albums in order of Genre.

    • sortAlbumArray

      public void sortAlbumArray​(int leftInd, int rightInd, java.lang.String sortBy)
      Recursive method that sorts Album array in ascending order by Genre or Release Date using Merge Sort
      Parameters:
      leftInd - is the left index of the array
      rightInd - is the right index of the array
      sortBy - to sort either by "genre" or by "date"

    • mergeAlbumArray

      private void mergeAlbumArray​(int leftInd, int mid, int rightInd, java.lang.String sortBy)
      Helper method to merge two sorted arrays
      Parameters:
      leftInd - is the left index of the array
      mid - is the midpoint of the array
      rightInd - is the right index of the array
      sortBy - to sort either by "genre" or by "date"

    • copyArray

      private void copyArray​(Album[] originalArray, Album[] newArray, int len, int offset)
      Copy one array to another
      Parameters:
      originalArray - is the array we are copying from
      newArray - is the array we are copying into
      len - is the length we want to copy
      offset - is the point in the original array from where we want to copy

      Accessor method that returns the number of albums

      number of Albums
